sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Edinburgh, the seventh day of December, one thousand six hundred and sixty five. The Lords of his Majesties Privy Council finding it now, after a long and tender forbearance, necessary that their acts of the third of December ... Scotland. Privy Council. Wedderburn, Peter, Sir, 1616?-1679.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Evan Tyler, Printer to the King's most excellent Majesty, Edinburgh : 1665.
Title from caption and first two lines of text. Royal arms at head of text; initial letter. Text in black letter. Signed at end: Pet. Wedderburne, Cl. Sti Concilii. A proclamation ordering the removal of all non-juring ministers. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
=======
Edinburgh, the seventh day of December, one thousand six hundred and sixty five. The Lords of his Majesties Privy Council finding it now, after a long and tender forbearance, necessary that their acts of the third of December ... Scotland. Privy Council. Wedderburn, Peter, Sir, 1616?-1679.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Evan Tyler, Printer to the King's most excellent Majesty, Edinburgh : 1665.
Title from caption and first two lines of text. Royal arms at head of text; initial letter. Text in black letter. Signed at end: Pet. Wedderburne, Cl. Sti Concilii. A proclamation ordering the removal of all non-juring ministers. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
the King's most excellent Majesty
Evan Tyler
